Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Olympian \O*lym"pi*an\ ([-o]*l[i^]m"p[i^]*an), Olympic \O*lym"pic\ ([-o]*l[i^]m"p[i^]k), a. [L. Olympius, Olympicus, Gr. 'Oly`mpios, 'Olympiko`s, fr. 'O`lympos: cf. F. olympique. See {Olympiad}.] Of or pertaining to Olympus, a mountain of Thessaly, fabled as the seat of the gods, or to Olympia, a small plain in Elis. [1913 Webster]
Olympic adj 1: of or relating to the Olympic Games; "Olympic winners" 2: of the region of Olympia in Greece or its inhabitants; "Olympian plain" [syn: {Olympian}]
